nodes.text: Sutherland rejected the often-heard criticism that the Uruguay Round of trade negotiations which led to the creation of the WTO was biased against the interests of developing countries.
even the world's poorest countries have benefited from free trade.
the poor have been given greater opportunities to develop
A greater number of development opportunities is a form of benefit
A nation can be said to be benefited by something when from that action follow more advantages than disadvantages
by the opening of borders than they would have if we had remained in a world of regional and national economies
The opening of borders created new opportunities of development
